intro: Euclea racemosa subsp. racemosa, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and has a compact, rounded crown. The plant features small, alternate, ovate leaves with a glossy green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are yellow, clustered in racemes, and appear in spring, followed by small, round, yellowish fruits. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions.
